title: Gabby Logan  absolutely thrilled  as she secures top job alongside Jamie Carragher
body_text:
EXCLUSIVE: Gabby Logan 'absolutely thrilled' as she secures top job alongside Jamie Carragher
Gabby Logan has struggled to contain her excitement after signing to become the host of this year's Women's Football Awards alongside Eni Aluko and Jamie Carragher
TV icon Gabby Logan has bagged herself a top job. The veteran broadcaster will be the official host of the 2025 Women's Football Awards.
The prestigious ceremony, which is Europe's largest awards celebration for women's football, will take place this May and will honour all aspects of the game - from grassroots talent to the superstar players on the pitch.
Gabby Logan, a prominent figure in sports broadcasting, will bring her unique energy and expertise to the event. She'll be joined by fellow presenters including football icon Jamie Carragher and former Lioness Eni Aluko, who will share their insights on the growth and impact of women's football.
"I am absolutely thrilled to be hosting the 2025 Women’s Football Awards in May," Gabby said. She went on to add: "This event continues to grow year after year, shining a well-deserved spotlight on the star athletes, dedicated teams, and organisations that are driving the extraordinary rise of women's football. The impact of women's football has never been greater and I’m looking forward to celebrating all of the inspirational nominees and winners at the ceremony."
The 2025 Women's Football Awards will recognise the exceptional contributions to the sport, from individuals and teams to the innovative brands and partners shaping the future of women's football. With the rise of the women's game across Europe, this year's awards will celebrate the achievements that have propelled the sport to new heights, inspiring future generations.
Past winners of the Women's Football Awards include notable players such as Alessia Russo, who was instrumental in England's 2022 Euro victory; Keira Walsh, a midfield dynamo for both Barcelona and England; Lauren James, renowned for her thrilling flair and skill; and Missy Bo Kearns, an emerging talent in the Women's Super League. Premier League legends like Declan Rice, Harry Kane, and Tyrone Mings have also backed the awards, contributing to the elevation of women's football and its ongoing expansion.
Jamie Carragher added: "I'm looking forward to joining Gabby and Eni for the 2025 Women's Football Awards. The growth of women’s football is undeniable, and it's inspiring to see more talent, passion, and opportunity than ever before."
With support from Shein, VISA, Morrisons, and the Premier League, the 2025 ceremony is set to be an unforgettable evening. The awards will highlight a variety of categories, acknowledging excellence across the entire spectrum of women's football.
The event annually draws high-profile celebrities. Spice Girls icon Melanie C, musician Fleur East, broadcasters Myleene Klass and Roman Kemp were among those who attended last year's event.
The eagerly awaited shortlist for the 2025 Women's Football Awards will be unveiled on 11 March 2025.
